line.en: The first term finals were known as the\nunluckiest of all the regular tests.

In the summer, there were many national
tournaments for both the sports and cultural
clubs, and the preliminary rounds for these were
often held during the test and pre-test weeks of
the first school term.
For graduating students, these tournaments would\nbe their last chance to participate in their\nclubs, so after they finished their midterms,
many of them threw themselves headlong into their\nclub activities, urging the junior members along\nwith them.
And so to me, it felt like out of all the five\nmajor test periods in a school year, these tests\nwere the most inconvenient.
I wished I could get angry at the tests\nthemselves.
'Everyone at school seems really flustered\nlately.'
Classes had finished, and we were on the way to\nour club.
Asa suddenly mentioned what she'd noticed.
'Well, yeah. It's always like that at this time\nof year.'
'It's kind of dazzling.'
'You think so?'
'It wouldn't seem so busy if everyone weren't so\nlively. So I think it's a really bright\natmosphere.'
'Do you like being busy better than taking it\neasy, Asa?'
'I think it's wonderful just to be able to feel\nbusy.'
Asa was a bit of a poet.

No matter how small a thing was, or how much
others usually took it for granted, Asa was still
able to give her honest and specific reaction to
it.
Every day must feel so fresh to her. Perhaps it\nwas because of her rich upbringing.
'How are you doing with your studies for the\ntests?'
'Alright, I suppose.'
Judging from her reaction, it wasn't going too\nbadly.
I'd asked the others as well, but fortunately it\nseemed as though the members of Soaring were\nkeeping up with their studies.
'I always get average results on my test. Just\naverage, not bad or anything...'
'Same with me. There's nothing wrong with that.'
'It's not bad, but even when I try really hard, I\nstill can't score any better than average, and\nthat makes me feel kinda bad.'
'After all, I've always had Yoru to compare\nmyself to.'
It's true that having a genius for a twin sister\nmight make one think differently about one's\ngrades.
And comparing oneself to someone like that would\nonly invite frustration.
'Speaking of Yoru, how is she doing?'
'Well, you and I both had cleaning duty today,\nright? So she said she'd go on ahead.'
'...She's going there before us?'
'...Yeah? Is there something wrong with that?'
Yoru wasn't a club member, and had never tried to\nbecome one, but she was going to our club ahead\nof us. Huh.
'Nothing.'
'What is it? You're smiling.'
'No, no, it's nothing.'
'Aoi, what made you want to fly in the sky?'
'Huh?'
'Soaring Club. What made you decide to join it?'
'Or, um, is that a rude thing to ask?'
'Huh? No, it's fine.'
'Oh, thank goodness. I've been worried that I've\nbeen a little too presumptious around you\nlately.'
'Not at all. I'm happy you seem to feel\ncomfortable around me.'
'I'm glad to hear that, too, then.'
I actually had a lot more fun now that we could\ntalk so easily, rather than before, when she was\ntrying harder to be polite.
Obviously I'd prefer someone to open up to me\ninstead of feeling guarded around me.
'Let's see... Why did I join Soaring...? Hmmm,\nthere were a lot of reasons.'
'Yes?'
Now that she mentioned it, this wasn't something\nI'd really talked about much with anyone.
Because it meant that I had to talk about the\ndream I'd given up on.
Was it shame? Regret?
I think I was worried that I'd look bad if I\nexplained the real reasons...
But more than that, I still didn't feel that I'd\nmoved on decidedly enough to really talk about\nthe past.
To talk about the dream I used to have.
'Is it difficult to answer?'
'A long time ago, I used to ride a bicycle.'
'A bicycle? You mean like in races?'
'Yeah, I raced. I was a road racer. It was my\nhobby, almost my reason for living. I used to\nlove bicycles.'
'Hmm... Yeah, I can see you as a bicycle rider,\nAoi! I think you'd look really cool!'
'Ahaha, thanks!'
It had been a long time since I'd talked about\nroad racing.
'But one day, I got hurt. I couldn't continue.'
It was such an enormous loss to me.
With no warning, or time to prepare.
I just suddenly lost my dream, my reason for\nliving, everything I had. It was taken from me.
'It was just so sudden. I suddenly lost\neverything I had in the world.'
'It was partly the shock from that accident that\nbrought me back here to Kazegaura...'
'I see...'
'So when I came back to Kazegaura, where I used\nto live so long ago, I thought I'd start over\nfresh with a new school life.'
'And just then, I saw a glider circling through\nthe air.'
'...That was... I mean, was it...?'
'It was Amane. I just happened to see her test\nflight. As it happens, that's also when I met\nKotori...'
'Wow. It sounds like something out of a drama.'
'It wasn't really that big of a deal. But...'
But...
'I guess that's when I fell in love with the\nsky.'
...Huh?
Now that I noticed, my feelings about the glider\njust kept pouring out in words.
At some point I'd apparently come to care about\nit so much that I really did want to tell someone\nabout it.
'And various other things happened after that...\nI met Amane at school, and learned about Soaring,\nand joined the club.'
'And that's how I decided I was going to fly.'
'Like finding a brand new love.'
Love? My new love?
'You lost something, and felt like you'd failed,\nbut then... You found something new, and it gave\nyou hope again.'
'I think that's just like falling in love for the\nsecond time.'
'...Maybe it is.'
If road racing was my first love, then the glider\nwas my second one.

'I still don't really understand why I fell in
love with the sky, though. Maybe it's because
it's so big, or so high. At any rate, I just knew
I wanted to fly in it.'
Even if I couldn't race quickly, I could fly\nhigh.
Maybe that's what I felt back then.
'I hope you're able to fulfill that love.'
'That'd be nice.'
'I'd like to help you. I'll do what I can to\nhelp!'
'Ahaha, thanks, Asa!'
Of course, she'd already helped us a lot just by\njoining the club when we really needed members.
'Why do you like the sky, Asa?'
'...I want to reach something that can't be\nreached.'
As she spoke, Asa reached upwards and seemed to\ntry to grab the sky.
'Since I'm always way down here on the ground, I\nlook up to it and admire it.'
'And I feel like, if I can somehow get up there,\nup high, just once, then I'll know that even\nsomeone like me can really reach it.'
'I think I'll be able to believe it then. Don't\nyou think that would be wonderful?'
Admiration.
Maybe her feelings were a bit like mine.
...Maybe she was in love, too.
'...Yeah, I think it'd be wonderful.'
'Right?'
Asa's smile sparkled like diamonds.
It was just a coincidence that had brought Asa to\nmy dorm, and if she hadn't come there, she might\nnot have joined Soaring Club.
But I feel like the fact that she did join was\nfate.
'Every day has been so fun recently.'
'In such a natural environment, with such fun\npeople. We have a specific goal, to fly in the\nsky, and we're working together to reach it.'
'I feel like my everyday life has been completely\nreborn. The short and boring hour hand has been\ntransformed into the second hand of the clock.'
'So you feel busy?'
'That's right. So I feel like I'm alive.'
Her smile was so bright, and so cute...
...Pat, pat, stroke.
'Ah, I'm sorry. Your head just seems made for\nstroking.'
'What are you doing, acting like I'm a pet or\nsomething...? Do you do that to everyone, Aoi?'
'No, it's just that you're so cute, and your head\njust looked like it'd be nice to stroke, and...\nWell...'
'So you really do see me as a pet...'
I was just reacting naturally, but depending on\nwho I did it too, it could be interpreted as\nsexual harrassment.
It might be okay with Ageha or Kotori, but I\nstill hadn't known Asa for that long.
'You're like an accidental pick-up artist, Aoi.'
'Huh?'
'Nothing!'
'Hello!'
'Hellooo!'
We greeted the others as we entered the dock.
'Um, what should I do here?'
'Hmm, there you should...'
... Huh?
There was something really strange going on when\nwe arrived.
...Wha?
'What is it? You two just got here and now you're\njust standing there with your mouths hanging\nopen.'
'N, no, it's just... Yoru's helping...'
'I thought it seemed unusual.'
'Ah. Well, the two of us weren't quite enough. We\nneeded a little help.'
'And you were late. So she offered to help us.'
That really was unusual. Yoru offered to help, of\nher own volition.
'What, is there something wrong with me helping?'
'No, it's not wrong, just... surprising.'
'I turned her down, 'cause I thought it might\nbring on a typhoon.'
'Yoru, did you eat something strange?'
'...Sis, I can't help feeling that everyone is\nbeing very rude to me.'
'Ahaha, sorry, sorry!'
'Well, I suppose it is true that I don't usually\nhelp out here, and I don't plan to do it much\nfrom now on either.'
'Now that you two are here, I don't need to help\nanymore. I'll get back to my studying.'
'Okay. Thanks, Yoru.'
'...Aah, that was such a pointless way to spend\nmy time. What a waste.'
With that, Yoru sat down on her usual step, took\nher book out of her bag, and started studying.
'I'd feel more grateful if she didn't complain so\nmuch.'
'She's covering up her shyness.'
'...Really?'
'Yoru wouldn't help at all if she didn't want to.\nIt's her policy not to do anything she doesn't\nwant to.'
'Well, at any rate she really did help us. We\nmanaged to accomplish more than I'd expected.'
'That's true. We've been moving along so smoothly\nlately it's actually freaking me out.'
Everything really was moving along well. So well\nthat I was starting to wonder what the catch was.
'That's it! The club's going well, so after these\ntests are over and everything's calmed down a\nbit, let's all go together!'
'Go where?'
'Where else would we go in the summer? The sea!\nLet's go swimming in the sea!'
Aaah, I see.
'The sea... Isn't it far?'
'It's not the sea, but there's a place we can\nswim that's much closer.'
'I've never heard of such a place.'
'Even the locals don't know our secret spot!\nWe'll show it to you later!'
It really was a secret spot.
Even now, I almost never see anyone there but\nourselves.
'If we can finish laminating the main wings by\nthen, that'll be perfect. We'll have to wait for\nthe resin to harden after that anyway.'
'Yeah, that's right. So let's hurry and finish\nthat part, so we can go swimming right after we\nfinish our tests!'
'Yeah!'
'Oh, I see you're having fun!'
'An-chan!'
A rare visitor showed up.
'Huh? What brings you here today?'
'I brought the supplies you ordered.'
'I could have just asked you to come pick them\nup, but I wanted to see your new workplace.'
'I see. I'm impressed you were able to find the\nplace!'
'That's because I showed him.'
'Oh, Masatsugu, what are you doing here?'
'I was heading home when I just happened to run\ninto An-chan. And since he said he wanted to come\nhere, I showed him the way.'
'I'm here too, Aoi.'
Even Akari was there.
'And what brings you here, Akari?'
'I was going home, but Masatsugu chased me down.\nThen we ran into Igarashi-san, and you know the\nrest.'
'Anyway, as a member of the student council, I\nwanted to see Soaring Club's new workplace, so\nthis was a perfect opportunity.'
'I see.'
So that's why we suddenly had so many guests.

'By the way, you know that a student's main job
is to study, right? I won't tell you to stay away
from your club entirely, but make sure you study
too, okay?'
'I'll keep that in mind.'
'Ahem. Well, anyway, I can see that you're all\ngetting along well here, so I guess I'm finished\nhere...'
Akari looked at Asa.
'But actually, this is the first time we've\nofficially met, isn't it? I'm Akari Kumoi,\nstudent council president.'
'N, nice to meet you! I'm a Asa Kazato, a first,\nyear student!'
'Don't be so nervous. You're the chairman's\ngranddaughter, right? Nice to meet you!'
'Yes! Thank you!'
'And, that is...'
Akari looked over towards Yoru, and greeted her.
'I'm Akari Kumoi. A pleasure.'
'... Yoru Kazato. I'm not a club member but\nsomehow I ended up here. Pleased to meet you.'
She responded to Akari in her usual, none too\nfriendly manner.
'Hey, Aoi. Those are both some high class ladies!\nWhat's up with that?'
'What's up with what...?'
'Why didn't you tell me?'
'What was I supposed to tell you...? If Akari\nhears you saying stuff like that, it's not my\nfault, you know!'
'Ah, good point. Please don't tell her I said\nthat!'
'I can hear you, Masatsugu.'
'Uwaah?!'
Akari slid up to Ma-bou with a demonically fierce\nexpression.
'No, you've got it wrong, Akari! It's not what it\nsounded like!'
'Well then, I'm finished here, so I'll be off.\nPlease don't stay here too late.'
'Yes'm! Good luck with your student council\nstuff!'
'See you, Akari.'
'Ah! Wait for me, Akariiiiiii!'
Ma-bou and Akari left the dock.
'...What noisy people.'
'I think Ma-bou's the only noisy one...'
'Akari's a little scary, isn't she? I get nervous\ntalking to her.'
'Yeah, I totally understand.'
Akari could be pretty overbearing.
That's probably why she was so good at an\nimportant leadership job like student council\npresident.
'By the way, is Amane here today?'
'Hm? Oh, I'm not sure if she's coming today.\nAmane tends to come and go as she pleases.'
'Hmmm, I see. I guess she's not actually a member\nafter all, and she seems pretty busy. But, huh,\nokay...'
'What is it, An-chan?'
'Oh, it's just kinda weird. That Soaring still\nexists, even without her.'
'And you've even got more junior members.'
'Ah... I'm Asa... Kazato!'
'I know, I heard you before. I'm Tasuya Igarashi.\nNice to meet you.'
'N, nice to meet you!'
'This girl seems a little like Amane.'
'...Eh? Really?'
'She seems intelligent.'
An-chan could apparently sense that.
'I'm Tatsuya Igarashi. Pleased.'
'...Yoru Kazato. Not a member, but nice to meet\nyou.'
But no matter who she was talking to, Yoru was\nalways like this at first.
'Well then, I'd better be off soon.'
'Won't you have a cup of tea first? I'll get you\nsome!'
'Nah, I'm okay. I don't have that much free time\nanyway.'
With that, An-chan headed for the exit.
'One dream is passed on to the next generation...\nAh, youth.'
Leaving those words behind, he left the dock.
'...He seems very mature. And dependable.'
'Yeah, he is. He always listens to me and lets me\ndiscuss my problems with him.'
I also thought of An-chan as quite an adult.
'What does he mean, 'youth'? What an idiot.'
'Well then, An-chan and the others have all left,\nso let's get back to work.'
'We've gotta do our best to keep the club going.'
'Yeah!'
'L, let's go!'
'Alright, let's call it a day.'
We'd reached a good stopping point, so I called\nout to everyone.
'Gotcha! I'll start cleaning up.'
'Good work today, everyone!'
'It really feels nice to hear that from Asa. It\nreally makes a difference coming from such a cute\ngirl.'
'What are you, an old man?'

'But the whole club really seems more pleasant
with Asa here, don't you think? We didn't really
have any comforting personality types here
before.'
'You've got a point. Neither you or Kotori is\nvery comforting.'
'What did you say?!' 'What do you mean?!'
It was one thing for Kotori, but Ageha shouldn't\nbe getting angry when she brought it up\nherself...
'Hehehe'
'Oh dear, An-chan just came to bring us this\nstuff today, but we already discovered some more\nmaterials we need. What should we do?'
'We need to look them up and order them, but...'
'Ah, in that case I'll look them up and make a\nlist soon! I'll order them from Igarashi-san\ntoo.'
'Great, then I'll be counting on you, Asa.'
'Alright!'
We all started heading home together, although\nAgeha would be leaving along the way.
Let's see... I had to go home, get dinner ready,\nand then study.
Just as Asa said, we'd all been really busy\nlately.
With the club, and studying.
There was a lot of work to do.
'Yeah, and then...'
'I still don't really think so...'
'Ahaha, is that right?'
Recently, Asa had started interacting with the\nothers more.
Their ages may be different, but they were still\nall girls. She spoke louder with them than she\ndid with me, and seemed more excited.
I guess some things are different when it's just\ngirls talking together.
I happened to glance back, and saw Yoru walking\njust a bit apart from the others, slightly behind\nus.
Unlike Asa, she still hadn't seemed to open up to\nthe others at all.
She didn't even seem to want to.
I walked over to Yoru and talked to her.
'Thanks for today, Yoru.'
'Huh?'
'For helping out until Asa and I got there.'
It really had been surprising to see Yoru helping\nout today.
Even though she seemed to be opening up to me in\nher own way, just a little, I never thought she'd\nactually go out of her way to help us.
'I just happened to feel like doing it. Don't\nmisunderstand , there's no deep meaning behind\nit.'
'I'm not reading anything into it. I'm just\nhappy.'
'...Alright then.'
I was plenty happy just at the fact that Yoru had\nhelped us at all, despite seeming like she\nwouldn't.
'I can't just leave it alone. Any place that's\nthat important to my sister is important to me\ntoo.'
'So I'll help a little. And when I think of it\nthat way, I guess helping out isn't a complete\nwaste.'
'You really like Asa, don't you?'
'I'd say I respect her more than just like her.'
'Respect?'
'She has what I don't.'
That was an unexpected thing for her to say.
I knew that Yoru liked Asa, but it seemed strange\nfor her to use the word 'respect.
Yoru seemed to be more skilled than Asa in a\nnumber of ways.
And she also seemed to look down on a lot of\npeople, or at least, she didn't seem to respect\nmany.
I just found it odd that she used the word\n'respect' at all.
'What is it? Did I say something strange?'
'No, nothing. Sorry.'
It would be rude to Asa to say that out loud, in\nfact it might have been rude to even think it, so\nI didn't feel the need to say it out loud.
'Hmmm, well, whatever. At any rate, I respect\nher.'
'You're good sisters to each other.'
'Praise all you want; it won't get you anything.'
'I wasn't expecting a reward.'
'Hmph, I wonder. I'll have to warn my sister to\nwatch out for you, in case you try to seduce her\ntoo.'
'Eh? What do you mean?'
Yoru seemed to think that I'd been trying to\nseduce her just now.
'Pbbth to you!'
Yoru stuck her tongue out at me, then ran off\ntowards the dorm.
'What was that? Did she turn down your advances?\nCheer up!'
'No, that's not it, but...'
'Don't worry; there's always a reason to keep\nliving.'
'No, I told you, that's not it...'
'...Aoi, you're really good at getting to know\npeople, aren't you?'
'Huh?'
'Yoru seems to think very well of you. That's\nunusual.'
Huh? She thinks well of me?
That's what that meant...?
'She talks to you about a variety of things. Just\nthat is a sign that she likes you. Especially\nwith someone like Yoru.'
'Hmmm, I wonder, is that really true...?'
It sure looked to me like she hated me.
'Hee hee!'
'Eh? What, what? Are you talking about how\npopular Aoi is?'
'Oh man, just don't ruin our club by getting in\nrelationship trouble with the members!'
'I'm not gonna!'
Finally the tests finished, and we got a\nvacation.
Thanks to the equipment at the dock, we'd become\nmuch more efficient, and our glider project was\ngoing even better than we'd hoped.

We were even a little ahead of schedule. And
after the tests, we were able to concentrate our
energy on the construction, so we got even
further ahead.
It was all smooth sailing.
Yesterday we finished laminating the main wings,\nand just as we'd discussed, we had some time to\nwait for the resin to harden.
And so, today...
It was time to go to the lake, as we'd promised.
'Wow, I can't believe such a great place exists!'
'...It's pretty.'
Asa and Yoru were surprised to see Ageha's\nspecial lake.
It was the secret base where we'd played as\nchildren, and where we came to make memories last\nyear as well.
'We found this spot just by chance when we were\nkids, and we're proud of our secret hideout!'
'I was really surprised when I first saw it last\nyear, too. I had no idea it was here.'
Almost every person we brought here had the same\nreaction.
I guess it was just that good of a place.
'Wait, we came here to swim, right? Where can we\nchange into our swimsuits?'
'Huh? Oh, there's a hollow over there where\nnobody will see you.'
'Wha?! We're supposed to change outside?!'
'Yeah. It's okay; no one can see you there.'
Asa looked startled.
Oh yeah, unlike us wild kids, Asa had grown up in\na sheltered home.
She wouldn't be used to crude things like\nchanging outside.
'Uh, ummm, I think that's a little too\nembarrassing for me...'

'I told you, it's okay. We always change over
there, and if you're worried about Aoi seeing
you, Hat will guard you and make sure he doesn't
come near!'
'Quack quack!'
'I, in that case...'
'...I'll pass.'
'Oh no, we won't let you get away with that,\nLittle Kazato!'
'Get out of my way, Kotori. I won't go swimming\ntoday.'
'You have nothing to blame but your own bad luck,\nnow that you've come here with us!'
'...(sigh) I'm not even a member, so you don't\nhave any right to force me, you know.'
'Urgh...'
It was just as she said. Kotori had no right to\nmake Yoru swim.
'Eeh, you're not gonna swim, Yoru?'
'Well, we'd have to change outside, right? That's\njust so uncivilized, I don't want to do it.'
'But we've come here just to swim, and I'm sure\nit'll be fun! Come on and swim with me, Yoru!'
'(sigh) Okay, Sis. That is why we came, after\nall. And we almost never go swimming together\noutside of class.'
'Yeah. I'm so happy you'll join me!'
In the end, it looked like Yoru would be swimming\ntoo.
That made me happy, too, since they were both\npleasing to the eye.
'Let's go, Asa!'
'Y, yeah!'
'Juuuump!'
Boing
'Eeeeeeeyaaaaaaah!!'
Asa flew through the sky, along with a drawn, out\nscream.
A few seconds later...
Splaaaaash
She and her scream disappeared together in the\nmiddle of a smallish rippling splash.
'Ooh, she flew pretty far!'
'That might be a new record.'
'Fwah... Th, that was scary!'
'Good job, Asa! Now you're a real member of\nSoaring Club!'
'Quack quack!'
'...What is the point of this?'
'A test of courage?'
'Nah, it's practice, to learn what it feels like\nto fly.'
After changing into our swimming suits, we\nenjoyed swimming in the lake , but only after\nSoaring's traditional rite of passage.
Just as a lion, king of the jungle, pushes its\ncubs into a valley, we sent our junior members\nfrom a high rock down into the lake.
We called it the 'Submerging Ceremony.
'Yoru, do you want to jump too?'
'I'll pass. I'm not a member of Soaring Club\nanyway.'
'Well, you could join it right now!'
'...Huh?! Why should I join Soaring? ... You just\nwant to push me into the water, Tori, don't you?'
'I think you're just scared. It looks like even\nthe brilliant Little Kazato is afraid of\nsomething.'
'...Tori, are you trying to provoke me?'
'Why no, I'm not trying to provoke you at all!\nI'm just looking forward to labeling Little\nKazato a coward.'
'...(sigh) I give up. You want me to jump? I'll\njump.'
Yoru put a float ring around herself and then,\nnot waiting for anyone to help, jumped right in.
Splaaaaash
'...I win!'
'No, I'd say you lost.'
What was she trying to accomplish, anyway? Yoru\nwas younger than her.
'I wish Amane could have come too, though. We\neven have new young members and everything.'
'Couldn't be helped. She was even bragging that\nshe was an adult, and thus a creature in a\nconstant battle with time.'
'She did want to come, though. Next time our\nschedules allow for it, we can all come\ntogether.'
'...I, I'm back!'
'I jumped, Tori.'
Asa and Yoru came back together.
'Good job, you two. How was it?'
'It was really thrilling!'
'...It felt better than I'd expected.'
It seemed that both of them had enjoyed the\nexperience.
'So now you two are real members of Soaring\nClub!'
'I still haven't joined, actually.'
'Don't be bothered by details! So, what should we\ndo now?'
'I've got a beach ball.'
'Oh, then let's play beach volleyball. Or would\nyou rather swim?'
'I just swam a little bit already, so either\none's fine with me.'
'Either's fine with me, too.'
'Volleyball it is, then!'
We finally decided to all play beach volleyball\ntogether.
'Okay, Asa, I'm gonna start. Go!'
A little unsteady on her feet in the sand, Kotori\nstarted us off.
'Oooh, got it! Ageha!'
Asa just managed to get the ball and send it over\nto Ageha.
'Alright, alright! Next, Aoi!'
'Ohh, got it! Here, Yoru!'
The ball had moved along nicely among the rest of\nus, so I directed it at Yoru.
'Okay, then Tori.'
Without any hesitation, Yoru sent it on to\nKotori.
'Who's this 'Tori'? Okay, Asa!'
'Wah, uwaaah, the ball went the wrong way!'
'That's okay, Sis. You can send it flying in any\ndirection you want, and I'll cover for you.'
Yoru ran over to meet the ball's trajectory, and\nskillfully sent it on its way.
Apparently Yoru was good at sports, too.
Those two sisters made a good combination.
Hummmmm
I felt like I heard a strange sound or something.
'...Hey, can you hear something?'
'Hmm? Hear what?'
Yoru caught the ball out of the air and held it,\nstopping the game.
Rustle rustle
The grass moved?!
'Over there!'
Yoru smashed the ball into the grass.
It flew right on target and hit the grass with a\nlot of power behind it.
'Ow!'
A voice?! Someone's there?!
'Who is it?!'
'Wait a minute, Kotori! Aoi, let's catch him!'
'Yeah!'
The two of us sprung towards the sound in the\ngrass.
And there we found...
'Owww...'
'Ma-bou?!'
'Why are you here?!'
'No, it's just... Ahaha...'
For some reason Ma-bou was there.
And in his hand...
'A video camera...?'
'Wait a minute, were you...?'
'...N, no, this is.. It's not...'
'You've been secretly recording us.'
'Uh, umm, I heard that Soaring Club was coming\nhere to swim today, so...'
'I just thought I'd... film all of you brave and\nbeautiful members?'
'Smaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaash!'
'Oww! No voilence!'
'Where did you hear that, anyway?'
'Akari heard it from Kotori.'
'Me?! ...Oh yeah, this counts as a club activity\noutside of school or the dock, so I had to report\nit...'
I see, so that's how he knew.
So that meant that the weird sound I just barely\nheard earlier was the video camera.
'So you came here to secretly get us on film, you\nlittle perv.'
'...You're pretty brave, to come and film me in\nmy swimming suit.'
'I'm not interested in you, Ageha. I wanted to\nsee the Kazato sis,'
'Smaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaash!'
'No violence!'
Another of Ageha's smashes hit home.
The ball crashed against Ma-bou and bounced off.
'For now, just take that film out. I'm\nconfiscating it. Got it?'
'It's a memory card, not film, but...'
'Whatever. Give it to me. I'll erase the data.'
'Urrghh... Come on, it's just some swimming\nsuits... They're just playing...'
'No! Swimsuits or not, we don't like it!'
Despite his tears, Ma-bou took the memory card\nout of his video camera and handed it over.
'So, what should we do with him?'
'Forgive me already; it was just on a whim! I\ngave you the data, so can't you just let it go?'
'What would be appropriate for Ma-bou's\npunishment? What should we do...?'
'We could crucify him like in the old days. Stand\nhim up and then throw the ball at him.'
'That sounds good.'
'F, forgive meee!'
'Let's tell Akari! (with a bright expression)'
'N, not faaair!'
Poor Ma-bou.
But it was his crime and his punishment. Fair's\nfair.
'I, is that okay? To hit him with the ball...'
'Well, it's just a beach ball, so it shouldn't\nreally hurt at all. It should be fine.'
'Oh, that's right.'
Even Ma-bou, despite his pleas for forgiveness,\ndidn't look too serious about it.
He probably only decided to do such a weird thing\nin the first place because...
'Wow, Ma-bou, you really have always been\ndesperate for attention. And you never just admit\nit.'
'I wonder why he's always been like that...'
'Tsundere, isn't he?'
'Yup, tsundere.'
At any rate, it probably wasn't really because he\nwanted that secret tape.
Probably.
'Okay, let's go! Masatsugu!'
'Wait, Kotori, go easy on me!'
'Resistance is futile! Yaaaaaaah!'
'...(giggle)'
'Ah!'
'What is it, Asa?'
'No, it's just...'
'I just saw something wonderful.'
'You're really in a great mood today, aren't you,\nAsa?'
'Hm? You think so?'
'Yeah. You seem to be having so much fun...'
She'd been constantly smiling all day.
'Was it really that fun?'
'Huh? Oh, yes. It was definitely fun, but\nalso...'
'I saw something wonderful.'
'Something wonderful?'
'It's a secret.'
What had Asa seen?
I followed Asa's gaze, and saw Yoru's back.
'So what kind of music do you like, Little\nKazato?'
'I like... just classical.'
'Wow, just like a princess!'
For once, Yoru was chatting with Kotori and Ageha\nas we walked home.
Aaah, I see.
I began to understand why Asa was smiling so\nmuch.
'Everything's just going so well.'
'Yeah.'
Everything was going so smoothly.
I really thought that.
'This could have been a really difficult time,\nactually.'
'What do you mean?'
'For Soaring Club. We had to solve a lot of\nproblems to keep the club going and rebuild the\nglider, all in time for Morning Glory.'
'Before we started, I really wondered if we were\ngoing to be alright. We had a tight schedule, and\nsome almost impossible, looking problems.'
'But somehow it's all working out. When I think\nof it that way, it's really amazing.'
'There's a lot I don't know about, so I can't\nfeel exactly what you feel right now, but...'
'I think it probably is amazing! I mean,\neveryone's all together, and I think you're all\namazing.'
'...Thanks.'
'It's no easy thing to fly in the sky. And when I\nthink it may really happen, that's just\nfantastic.'
'And being together with all these amazing people\nis so great... I'm really happy.'
Asa gave a triumphant smile.
'You really do look happy when you smile, Asa.'
'Eh? R, really?'
'Yes. Just looking at you makes me happy too.'
'...Th, thank you.'
It always feels good to see someone smile, and\nAsa's felt even better.
I liked Asa's smile.
'Um, er, Aoi?'
'I'll help you cook dinner tonight.'
'Huh? But it's not your job tonight, Asa.'
'That's okay! I want to help you cook! I, I've\ngotten better at cooking recently!'
It's true that her cooking had improved lately.
So much that it was hard to believe she'd ever\nwashed vegetables with soap.
'W, would I be in the way?'
'No... Well then, thanks!'
'Alright!'
'What is it, Sis? Why do you look so pleased?'
'Huh?'
'You're humming. Didn't you notice?'
'Huh? Oh...'
'Did something good happen?'
'It's not that something good happened, so much\nas... Good things keep on happening.'
'What do you mean...?'
'Today was great too, but every day's been fun\nlately. It feels like everything's gonna turn out\nalright, like I can do anything I want.'
'I feel like I could fly.'
'...In other words, you're getting carried away.'
'Ungh!'
'But it's unusual for you to get carried away,\nand I'm genuinely happy to see you that way.'
'I didn't think you were the type to say 'things\nwill go well,' or 'I can do whatever I want.''
'...M, maybe that's true...'
'...You're on an updraft...'
'Huh?'
'I think you've found a good wind, Sis. It's\nleading your heart upwards.'
'Just like a Soaring Club should.'
'That's true for me, but haven't you changed a\nlittle as well, Yoru?'
'Huh?'
'Well, I don't think you would have made a goofy\npun like that before.'
'Shut up, Sis!'
'Hee hee!'
'Anyway, it's good to see you happy. You've\nseemed kind of down for the last few years, Sis.'
'...It's hard to admit it, but maybe it's a good\nthing we came here after all.'
'...Yeah.'
'I really am glad we came here. And joined\nSoaring, and met new friends.'
'And met Aoi.'
'I never thought I was doing anything right\nbefore.'
'I felt like a windmill with no wind. I wasn't\nspinning, and I was powerless. But...'
'Just like you said, Yoru, I feel like I'm riding\non an updraft now.'
'I've found where I belong.'

'...(There's definitely something not quite
stable about Sis right now. Maybe her new
environment and experiences are just brightening
her up, or maybe...)'
'Oh yeah, Yoru, did you know that Aoi...'
'You've been talking about Aoi a lot lately,\nSis.'
'Huh?'
'M, maybe I have.'
'Do you like him?'
'Huh?!'
'N, no!'
'...Really?'
'I respect him. I don't see him like that.'
'The sky. He's like the sky to me!'
'The sky, huh? Well, his name does mean 'blue'.'
'That's what I'm talking about! You used to never\nmake such horrible puns!'
'Ugh!'
'And besides, I could never presume to like\nsomeone so wonderful and above me like Aoi.'
'I've told you, you shouldn't hold yourself back\nfor no reason. What's so wonderful about him\nanyway?'
'I mean... Wait, what?'
'What is it, Yoru?'
'(Why do I suddenly feel relieved?)'
Soaring Club had been going so well, but the next\nday, I noticed the first sign of a storm cloud.
It had been going so well, so smoothly...
But apparently we'd been foolish to believe it\ncould last, anymore than a sugar and candy\ncastle.
'I'm sorry!'
'So, it looks like we won't be able to work on\nthe glider much for a while, then.'
'It looks that way.'
'Aaah... And things had been going so well, too.\nBut just a little mistake can do it...'
The stiffening agent we needed for the next step\nin the construction hadn't arrived, so we\ncouldn't continue.
The reason was...
'I'm sorry! I really am so sorry!'
Asa had messed up the order.
She'd offered to make a list of supplies and\norder them from An-chan.
'Even though I volunteered to do it myself, I...'
'Well, don't worry about it too much. We were\nahead of schedule already, so it'll be okay even\nif we're a little bit later with this step.'
'That's right. In fact, without some obstacles\nlike this, there'd be no thrill, right?'
'...At any rate, there are some other things we\ncan work on. Why don't we just start on those?'
'See, Asa? It's okay. You don't have to feel so\nbad about it.'
'...I'm... so sorry. I'm going outside for a\nmoment.'
With that, Asa left the dock.
Should I go with her? Maybe I should try to\ncomfort her.
...No, it would probably be better to let her be\nalone.
'There really is no reason for her to be so\nupset. I hope she's okay...'
'Hmmm... Well, everyone makes mistakes\nsometimes.'
'I've lost track of how many mistakes I've made\nover the years.'
'...Does Asa get depressed really easily?'
I tried asking Yoru.
'Sis is sometimes a little too hard on herself.'
'She's sensitive. Unlike me.'
'(I got carried away!)'
'(I was too carried away, too carried away, too\ncarried away, too carried away, too carried away,\ntoo carried away!!!)'
'(How is this 'helping their dream'? I'm no help\nat all!)'
'(I've gotten in the way of all of their\ndreams...)'
